pr_title: RHDM-1189: 'Unable to expand' exception with from condition in Guided Rule Editor with DSL option checked

timeline.bodyText: Please do not introduce new public api method as there is single occurence of it, in the same class.
timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText: OK.. the single parameter form of these methods (visitXYZ) are called by a relection-based visitor however the two parameter versions are only called internally but could be overridden so I've made them all protected. I hope that is more acceptable.
replies.author: manstis

timeline.bodyText:
Does this return true means we are saving rdslr file? I though it means the rules combine drools and dsl sentences, however I was wrong probably.
Can we please add test where a from expression and DSL sentence is present? Or do we have such test please?
timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText:
It replicates the state of validating a model when it was created as a rdslr file but has no actual DSL elements (as per https://issues.redhat.com/browse/RHDM-1189). Validation is called here and the source obtained here. RuleModelWrapper constructor set to true when the file is  .rdslr. It is used by RuleModelWrapper as the hasDSLSentences here.
Let me check about the test (or add one)....

replies.bodyText: @jomarko New tests added.. what a can of worms that opened.. but good they were added as it highlighted a bug (not only relating to my changes but also existing tests that contained from).

timeline.bodyText:
When I grep  RuleModelDRLPersistenceImpl class for occurrences of .append(">"); code snippet, I am now getting two kinds of occurrences:

">" is add/not added according variables isSubPattern and isDSLEnhanced
">" is add/not added according variable isDSLEnhanced

Shouldn't be ">" added/not added always according to both variables?
timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText:
@jomarko You are probably correct.. I can't think of any reason for it to be different.
I've added a new commit to ensure use of isSubPattern is used consistently in LHSPatternVisitor. Some occurrences were in RHSActionVisitor however this has no concept of sub pattern and hence can remain unchanged.
replies.author: manstis

timeline.message: RHDM-1189: 'Unable to expand' exception with from condition in Guided Rule Editor with DSL option checked
Ensure use of isSubPattern is used consistently in LHSPatternVisitor
